page.title: 01Inchberry & surrounding area
page.content: Nearly half of this area is wooded. It is a coniferous forest belonging to the Forestry Commision.The rest of the land is farmed. A railway runs north-south through the area.It comes from Elgin and goes to Aberdeen.The railway crosses the River Spey 7km south of Fochabers.The nearest station is Elgin (about 12km). The main road in the area is the B9015 which connects Mosstodloch and Rothes. The farms used to be crofts but were consolidated to form larger farms. Varied crops are grown including oats, hay and barley.Sheep are grazed on the higher ground and cattle are raised for the beef market.There is a small horticultural farm were{raspberries, {strawberries}and vegtables are grown. There is a shop at the farm selling their products.
